A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Visually stunning\, horribly written and acted piece of propaganda that intentionally dumps 40 years of Star Wars history into the trash bin. I'll agree with Kevin Smith's assessment that the Luke-R2 scene was great\, and Daisy Ridley's acting is admirable given the script limitations\, but otherwise this film completely misses the mark.

Disney would be better off canceling plans for IX and going back to the drawing board. Character development was nonexistent. Every male character is a buffoon. The 'strong' female characters suffer from Mary Sue syndrome.

If you are looking for strong female leads\, go back to Carrie Fisher's Leia in the original\, or go see Wonder Woman again. 

None of these characters -- Finn\, Poe Dameron\, Admiral Holdo\, Rey\, Snoke\, on and on -- show emotional or intellectual development. And the entire movie suffers as a result.

If this wasn't a Star Wars film it would be the biggest box office bomb of all time. But Disney is rapidly eroding fan support for the brand -- core or otherwise.
